ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Every obstructor of good, transgressor, and the sceptic,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: who hinders good, exceeds the limits, is immersed in doubts,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: who is an opponent of good, a suspicious transgressor
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “The one who excessively prevented from virtue, the transgressor, the doubtful.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Forbidder of good, exceeder of limits, doubter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: every hinderer of the good, transgressor, disquieter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: hinderer of good, transgressor, causing others to doubt,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [every] hinderer of good, transgressor, and skeptic,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Who forbade what was good, transgressed all bounds, cast doubts and suspicions;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: forbidder of good, transgressor and doubter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Preventer of good, aggressor, and doubter,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:25] hinderer of good, such as [the payment of] alms, transgressor, wrongdoer, skeptic, a doubter of his religion,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hinderer of good) i.e. Islam, he hindered his sons and his grandchildren and brother's children and family, relatives and kinsfolk, (transgressor) oppressor, (doubter) whose doubt is quite manifest and who further lies against Allah,
